list_definition.definition: a metal plate which, when struck, gives a ringing sound

list_ex_of_english: Bowl gongs are bowl-shaped, and rest on cushions and belong more to bells than gongs.
Furthermore, we have varied the beaters to further colour the spectral characteristics of each gong.
After a fixed set of cycles (approximately 150), the gong node will update its target level to a new random number from one to seven.
Old drawings also depict a smaller "yunluo" with just five gongs, which was held by a handle by one hand and played with the other.
Bells, gongs and spiral chimes could all be used, giving a distinct tone for each instrument.
A water gong is a musical gong that is dipped into a tank of water.
Rather than being restrictive, the use of half-a-dozen voices and a single gong proves in the event wonderfully rich.
The clock may also contain bells and gongs which act as strikers.
